subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The IPAA Official Nominees Site is now OPEN!

You're probably right. Sorry to cause a problem.

Jeremy




______________=
__________________
From: cheri <cesperon@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
.com
Sent: Wednesday, December 3, 2008 4:59:42 PM
Subject: RE: [EVP-ITC] Th=
e IPAA Official Nominees Site is now OPEN!


Personally, 
I was thankful fo=
r the original post and did check out the site=85. 
But I could have done w=
ithout all the bickering it caused.  One post that
some felt was annoying  =
has turned into 5 posts that are getting pretty darn
annoying.  (and now my=
 2cents makes it six)  wouldn=92t simply
ignoring or deleting the original =
posting been easier on everyone?
 
-----Original Message-----
From: EVP-ITC=
@yahoogroups .com
[mailto:EVP- ITC@yahoogroups. com] On Behalf Of Early Cuy=
ler
Sent: Wednesday, December 03, 2008
3:43 PM
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com=

Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The IPAA
Official Nominees Site is now OPEN!
 
Reje=
cting
spam is absolutely your right. It is also the right of others to post=
 what they
choose as long as it is within the guidelines of the groups mode=
rator of which
you are not. 

As far as my making the distinction, the head=
line of the post was clear as to
the contents, so therefore, you chose to r=
ead it. Now if someone was there
holding you against your will until you re=
ad it, then I apologize.

Jeremy





________________________________
 
Fr=
om:Clara Febach <cfebach@yahoo. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Wed=
nesday, December 3, 2008
4:05:14 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The IPAA
Officia=
l Nominees Site is now OPEN!
Dear Jeremy,
 
The length of membership is not=
 an issue for me. Someone who is a part of this group for a longer length h=
as no more rights than a newbie. I joined EVP-ITC not IPAA.  If I read mess=
ages sent from EVP-ITC I expect stuff related to that group ONLY.  If I joi=
n IPAA and read messages sent from IPAA then I expect stuff related to that=
 group ONLY as well.
 
If the message is sent by EVP-ITC and I open it and =
it is about something else entirely under the assumption it was about EVP-I=
TC, I WAS MADE TO READ IT. I'm sorry you cannot make that distinction.
 
Th=
ere is a difference between mentioning something off handedly vs. running a=
n entire ad. I do have the right to reject spam.
 
The moderator did reply =
to me and that was sufficient. Thank you very much.
 
~Clara

--- On Tue, 1=
2/2/08, Early Cuyler <ecuyler@yahoo. com> wrote:
From: Early Cuyler <ecuyle=
r@yahoo. com>
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The IPAA Official Nominees Site is now=
 OPEN!
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Tuesday, December 2, 2008, 1:29 P=
M
The IPAA is run by people who have been members for a long time. It is pa=
ranormal related and fine by me. No I'm not a member of IPAA, but they have=
 a right to post if they like as long as it does not break the rules. Nobod=
y is making you read the posts and you don't have to click anything you don=
't want to.

Jeremy 
 

________________________________
 
From:Clara Febac=
h <cfebach@yahoo. com>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Sent: Tuesday, December=
 2, 2008 2:49:50 PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The IPAA Official Nominees Site =
is now OPEN!
Who is IPAA and why am I receiving this information with a lin=
k for me to click on?
 
I would prefer not to receive these kinds of invita=
tions through this group.  I usually get enough ads as it is without gettin=
g them enclosed in messages from groups I belong to. In the past I have rec=
eived invitations sent directly to my email address and read them when it i=
s convenient for me to take EXTRA time to read them.
 
Please don't make me=
 hesitate to open EVP-ITC messages.
 
Thank you.

--- On Tue, 12/2/08, ghun=
y1 <itcnap@gmail. com> wrote:
From: ghuny1 <itcnap@gmail. com>
Subject: [EV=
P-ITC] The IPAA Official Nominees Site is now OPEN!
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups=
 .com
Date: Tuesday, December 2, 2008, 10:27 AM
Dear Friends,

Welcome to t=
he Official IPAA Nominations site. This is a new venture
and has never been=
 done before on this global level. This site, ANYONE
can join, it is FREE, =
you can showcase your work, network with others,
create projects with new f=
riends, and of course showcase your sincere
dedicated hard work, promote yo=
urselves, and promote your books,
movies, music, TV shows, radio shows, all=
 your talent in the
Paranormal! Networking and helping others in a haunting=
 or a Mufon
watch, the ideas are endless!

We are working hard to find spon=
sorships and unfortunately this 1st
annual event, donations are required to=
 help offset the awards. Any
donations at $25.00 or more would be greatly a=
ppreciated.

All nominees, will become featured members. The donations are =
good
till Nov 7, 2009 and that's a wonderful savings and very affordable
fo=
r all to participate and enjoy ALL YOUR hard work!

Sending You All the Bes=
t from IPAA

http://www.ipaaward s.org

Laura Kimberley,
Director of IPAA 
=
